page.title: 08A REDUNDANCY CASE IN BURTON
page.content: A local man worked for a cold-store company as a labourer. He and three others from a work-force of fourteen were given one week's notice of redundancy, because the firm had very few orders. They got no redundancy pay because they had not enough service to qualify. He lived on social security and unemployment benefit, applied for nine jobs, and luckily got one in three weeks. His family suffered little in this time, but his social life was 'cut in half', and he thought the future was bleak. He blames the Government for his lay-off, and says, "They don't concern themselves with England, but think of other countries like the Falklands and Ireland".
